Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of panel's analysis of state protection without assessing credibility or plausibility
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review of refugee claim decision
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not conducted prior to state protection analysis
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Personal account of persecution by Mexican police and drug traffickers
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section on subjective fear of persecution under IRPA
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Persecution due to involvement with criminal organizations or threats from state and non-state actors
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to assess subjective fear before analyzing state protection
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Refugee hearing and subsequent judicial review
Crimes.Application_Error: Omission of credibility and plausibility assessment
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Subjective fear must be assessed before objective analysis of state protection
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Applicant's detailed account of threats and persecution
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Credibility and plausibility are prerequisites to state protection analysis
Crimes.Application_Factor: Personal risk and past experiences in Mexico
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Denial of refugee status based on presumed state protection
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Sequence of legal analysis in refugee determination
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA sections on refugee definition and procedural fairness
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Presumed availability of state protection in Mexico
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of adverse credibility findings despite reliance on applicant’s narrative
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Violation due to premature conclusion on state protection
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of decision-making process
